intro: Teclea heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf teclea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, ranging from ovate to elliptical, and its small, white to pinkish flowers. Teclea heterophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
